questions.text: A 28-year-old male presents to the emergency department following an alleged sexual assault by a man. The victim recalls that the assault occurred approximately 4 hours ago. Which of the following examination findings would least likely support evidence of the current sodomy assault?

options.label: A
options.text: Linear abrasions or contusions in the perianal region

options.label: B
options.text: Dried semen around the anus

options.label: C
options.text: Paradoxical dilatation of anus during bimanual traction of buttocks

options.label: D
options.text: Prolapse of rectal mucosa

questions.correct_answer: C. Paradoxical dilatation of anus during bimanual traction of buttocks
questions.explanation:
Feature Habitual Passive Agent Non-Habitual Passive Agent
Anal sphincter tone Decreased or lax Normal or tight
Paradoxical anal dilatation Common (Option C) May be absent or mild
Perianal scars Frequently present (due to repeated trauma) Absent or rare
Radial mucosal folds Effaced or obliterated due to repeated stretching Usually well preserved
Rectal mucosa  May show signs of prolapse or eversion Normal unless recent severe trauma (Option D ruled out)
Local injury (abrasion/laceration) Usually absent (tissues adapted over time) Common after recent assault (Option A ruled out)
Pain/tenderness Often absent Typically present post-assault
Sphincter contraction on touch May be absent or weak Present (normal reflex)
Medical history May include chronic constipation or previous assaults Often no relevant history

questions.text: A 40-year-old male is arrested after being caught secretly watching women undress in a public locker room. He admits that he derives sexual pleasure from watching others undress and sometimes engaging in sexual acts. What is the likely paraphilic disorder?

options.label: A
options.text: Frotteurism

options.label: B
options.text: Voyeurism

options.label: C
options.text: Fetishism

options.label: D
options.text: Eonism

questions.correct_answer: B. Voyeurism
questions.explanation:
Category

Description

Transvestism/Eonism

Wearing clothes of the opposite sex (Common in males) (Option D)

Fetishism

Sexual satisfaction from inanimate objects like bras or underpants (Common in males) (Option C)

Voyeurism/Scoptophilia/

Peeping Tom

Watching someone undress or bathe (Specifically females)

 

Mixoscopia: Sexual gratification from watching others engage in sex.

Frotteurism

Rubbing private parts against a female’s buttocks or thighs (Option A)

Masturbation/Onanism/

Ipsation

Self-stimulation of genitalia.

Coprolalia

Obscene language.

Scatalogia

Obscene telephone calls.

Partialism

Sexual interest focused on a specific body part other than the genitalia.

Klismaphilia

Sexual gratification from enemas.

Ecouterism

Sexual arousal from hearing sounds associated with sexual activity.

Nymphomania

Excessive sexual desire in females.

Satyriasis

Excessive sexual desire in males.

Dippoldism

Teacher beating a student for sexual satisfaction (Named after German schoolmaster Dippold).

Gerontophilia

Sexual attraction to elderly individuals.

Pedophilia

Sexual attraction to children.

Narratophilia

Sexual arousal by reading erotic material.

Somnophilia

Sexual arousal from a stranger who is asleep.

Pyromania

Sexual satisfaction from setting fires.

Playing the Bagpipes

Intercourse under the armpits.

Troilism

Sexual activity involving three people.

questions.text: A 32-year-old male presents to the psychiatrist with complaints of unusual sexual desires. He reports feeling intense sexual gratification when inflicting pain on his partner during consensual intimate encounters. He denies any interest in other forms of sexual activity and mentions that causing pain is the primary source of his sexual arousal. What is the most likely paraphilic disorder?

options.label: A
options.text: Algolagnia

options.label: B
options.text: Uranism

options.label: C
options.text: Mooning

options.label: D
options.text: Cunnilingus

questions.correct_answer: A. Algolagnia
questions.explanation:
Category

Description

Sadism/Algolagnia

Getting satisfaction by giving pain to a partner.

Masochism/

Passive Algolagnia

Getting satisfaction by receiving pain from a partner.

Bondage

Combination of Sadism and Masochism.

Lust Murder

Murder acts as a stimulus for sexual arousal.

Urolagnia/Undinism/

Urophilia

Sexual arousal from urine smell, touch, or sight.

Uranism

Sexual gratification by fingering, fondling, licking, or sucking the genitalia of the opposite sex (Option B)

Coprophilia

Sexual arousal from fecal smell and touch.

Sexual Oralism
  • Fellatio: Oral stimulation of male genitalia.
  • Cunnilingus: Oral stimulation of female genitalia (Option D)

Exhibitionism

Showing private parts.

  • Streaking: Running naked in public.
 
  • Mooning: Showing bare buttocks (Mnemonic: Moon resembles buttocks) (Option C)
  • Flashing: Momentarily exposing body parts by quickly moving clothing (Mnemonic: like a flashlight)

Necrophilia

Sexual activity with a dead body.

Necrophagia

Eating parts of a dead body.

questions.text: Which of the following is a part of the SAFE kit? 1. 2. 3. 4. 5.

A 20-year-old male was brought for medicolegal examination after being accused of raping a girl 2 hours back. The examining physician noted the cheesy secretion around the corona glandis and conducted a thorough assessment of the genital organs, including a penile swab. Which of the following is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Cheesy material is inconsistent with his recent sexual intercourse

options.label: B
options.text: Lugol’s iodine test turns brown if vaginal cells are present

options.label: C
options.text: His consent for examination is needed

options.label: D
options.text: Lugol's iodine can be done till 4 days after rape

questions.correct_answer: C. His consent for examination is needed
questions.explanation:
Legal Basis
  • Examination under S.51 BNSS
  • Conducted with reasonable force
  • No consent needed
  • Request by SI

Burden of Proof
  • In cases of rape, the burden of proof is on males.

General Examination
  • Assess behavior, mental status, clothes for stains/tears,
  • Presence of female hair.

Genital Examination
  • Check for semen/sperm
  • Smegma (cheesy-like secretions) at corona glandis
    • Presence of smegma on an accused can be a useful clue and help refute a false rape charge.
    • if present, it is inconsistent with recent sexual intercourse.

(Option A)

  • However, the absence of smegma does not prove that rape did not occur (Can be rubbed off and show -ve results)
  • The smegma is rubbed off during intercourse which takes about 24 hours for re-deposition.

Vaginal Cell Examination
  • Examine the penis and glans for vaginal cells using Papanicolaou stain and Lugol's iodine.

Penile Swab Procedure
  • Obtain a swab, allow it to dry, and expose it to Lugol's iodine vapors
  • Brown indicates vaginal cells (glycogen present) (Option B)
  • Lugol's iodine can be done till 4 days after rape (Option D)

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of applying toluidine blue to the anogenital area during the examination of rape victim?

options.label: A
options.text: To enhance the visibility of foreign objects

options.label: B
options.text: To identify areas of micro-injury

options.label: C
options.text: To check for signs of infection

options.label: D
options.text: To prepare for DNA collection

questions.correct_answer: B. To identify areas of micro-injury
questions.explanation:
Step

Details

Request for Examination
  • Any police officer can request it within 24 hours.

Consent
  • Must obtain consent from the woman
  • Examination supervised by a female RMP.

Initial Examination
  • Ask the victim to remove clothing.
  • Examine and collect evidence from clothes.
  • Look for foreign objects (hairs, seminal stains) (Option A)
  • Search for physical injuries.

Detection of Micro Injuries
  • Apply toluidine-blue contrast to the anogenital area.

Swabs Collection
  • 4 swabs:
    • Smear: Prepare a smear for microscopic examination.
    • Sperm: Use saline for motility testing.
    • DNA Profiling (Option D)
    • Chemical Tests: Acid phosphatase, creatinine phosphokinase, lactate dehydrogenase.

Examination Position
  • Examine in lithotomy position under good lighting.

Hymen Examination
  • Use Glaister-Keene rods or hymenoscope
  • Look for tears (usually posterior at 5-7 o'clock position).

Vaginal Examination
  • Use a speculum for vaginal examination.

Cervical Examination
  • Use a colposcope for cervical examination.

Post-Examination Care
  • Treat STDs, injuries, or potential pregnancy.
  • Provide psychological support.

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman testified in court that she did not give consent during an alleged sexual assault. The case involves an offense under Section 63 of the BNS. During cross-examination, the defense lawyer attempts to question her about her past sexual relationships. The court intervenes and prevents this line of questioning. Which of the following provisions are relevant to this case?

options.label: A
options.text: BSA Section 48

options.label: B
options.text: BNS Section 48

options.label: C
options.text: BNSS Section 48

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above

questions.correct_answer: A. BSA Section 48

questions.text: During a news report, a journalist accidentally reveals the name of a woman who has accused her neighbor of rape under BNS Section 63. The report goes viral, causing distress to the victim. If the journalist is charged under BNS section 72, what is the maximum punishment they could face?

options.label: A
options.text: 1 year of imprisonment plus fine

options.label: B
options.text: 2 years of imprisonment plus a fine

options.label: C
options.text: 5 years of imprisonment without fine

options.label: D
options.text: A warning from the court with fine

questions.correct_answer: B. 2 years of imprisonment plus a fine

questions.text: A 26-year-old man is proven guilty of committing an offense of rape that resulted in the victim being in a persistent vegetative state. He is sentenced to 20 years of imprisonment. Under which BNS section is he most likely convicted?

options.label: A
options.text: BNS Section 65

options.label: B
options.text: BNS Section 66

options.label: C
options.text: BNS Section 67

options.label: D
options.text: BNS Section 68

questions.correct_answer: B. BNS Section 66

questions.text: During a forensic examination, a 25-year-old woman reports that she was raped by a colleague at a workplace event. The medical examination reveals no physical injuries but confirms non-consensual sexual intercourse. According to the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, what is the minimum punishment the accused would face?

options.label: A
options.text: 5 years of rigorous imprisonment

options.label: B
options.text: 7 years of rigorous imprisonment

options.label: C
options.text: 10 years of rigorous imprisonment

options.label: D
options.text: Life imprisonment

questions.correct_answer: C. 10 years of rigorous imprisonment

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT true regarding the POCSO Act?

options.label: A
options.text: It is designed to protect female children under the age of 18 from sexual abuse

options.label: B
options.text: It also includes protection against digital sexual crimes and exploitation against children.

options.label: C
options.text: The Act was amended in 2019, making punishments stricter.

options.label: D
options.text: Special courts have been established to ensure the swift disposal of POCSO cases

questions.correct_answer: A. It is designed to protect female children under the age of 18 from sexual abuse

questions.text: Under Section 63 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), which of the following scenarios does NOT constitute rape?

options.label: A
options.text: A man engages in sexual intercourse with a woman by falsely promising marriage, knowing he does not intend to marry her.

options.label: B
options.text: A husband forces his wife, who is above 18 years of age, into sexual intercourse without her consent.

options.label: C
options.text: A man engages in consensual sexual intercourse with a woman who is 17 years old.

options.label: D
options.text: A man has consensual sexual intercourse with a woman who is mentally incapacitated and unable to provide informed consent.

questions.correct_answer: B. A husband forces his wife, who is above 18 years of age, into sexual intercourse without her consent.

questions.text: Which of the following best represents an application of Locard's Exchange Principle in forensic investigations?

options.label: A
options.text: The use of DNA analysis to determine genetic relationships

options.label: B
options.text: The transfer of sweat and residue forming latent fingerprints on surfaces

options.label: C
options.text: The identification of drug metabolites in urine samples

options.label: D
options.text: The analysis of blood pressure to assess cause of death

questions.correct_answer: B. The transfer of sweat and residue forming latent fingerprints on surfaces

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding IPC 377 is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Pederasty involves an adult engaging in sexual activity with a child

options.label: B
options.text: Butch is typically the active agent

options.label: C
options.text: Minimum punishment for offenses is 10 years of imprisonment

options.label: D
options.text: Sapphism involves sexual relationships with a catamite

questions.correct_answer: D. Sapphism involves sexual relationships with a catamite
questions.explanation:
Type of Offense

Description

Active Agent

Passive Agent

Anal Offenses (Anal/ Greek love/ Sodomy/ Buggery)

Pederasty: Adult-child sexual relationship.

(Option A)

Pedarast (Adult)

Catamite (child)

Gerontophilia: Attraction to the elderly.

Gerontophile (Adult)

Old person

Oral Sex (Coitus per os,Sin of Gomorrah)

Fellatio: Oral stimulation of male genitalia.

Varies

Varies

Cunnilingus: Oral stimulation of female genitalia.

Bestiality

Sexual acts involving animals.

Humans

Lower animals

Lesbianism/Sapphism/Tribadism

Sexual relationships between females.

Butch/Dyke (Option B)

Femme

questions.text: A 30-year-old man approaches a lawyer seeking advice after discovering that his wife has been having an extramarital affair. He expresses anger and frustration, wanting to understand his legal options regarding this situation. Which of the following statements correctly reflects the legal status of adultery in India?

options.label: A
options.text: It’s a criminal offense punishable by imprisonment under IPC

options.label: B
options.text: The man can file a criminal case against his wife’s lover

options.label: C
options.text: The man can pursue a civil case for divorce

options.label: D
options.text: A serious offense that can lead to both criminal and civil liabilities

questions.correct_answer: C. The man can pursue a civil case for divorce
questions.explanation:
Type of Offense

Description

Legal Status in India

Rape

Forceful sexual intercourse
  • Criminal offense
  • Defined under IPC Sec 375

Incest
  • Sexual relationship between blood relations
  • Complexes:
    • Electra complex (Daughter-Father)
    • Oedipus complex (Son-Mother)
    • Pharaon (Brother-Sister)
  • Not a crime (no IPC provision)

Adultery

Extramarital affairs
  • Decriminalized
  • Civil case; grounds for divorce (Option C)

questions.text: Forensic analysts find hair samples at a crime scene and need to determine the origin of hair. They note the following characteristics: the medulla is thick, and the scale pattern shows coronal scales. What type of hair are they most likely examining?

options.label: A
options.text: Human hair

options.label: B
options.text: Animal hair

options.label: C
options.text: Synthetic hair

options.label: D
options.text: Insect hair

questions.correct_answer: B. Animal hair
questions.explanation:
Characteristic

Animal Hair

Human Hair (Option A)

Medulla

Thick

Narrow

Cortex

Thin

Thick

Scale Pattern

Coronal scales (C for Cattle)

Imbricate scales (I for Insaan)

Texture

Coarse and thick

Fine and thin

Medullary Structure

Continuous medulla

Discontinuous or absent medulla

Pigmentation

Pigment is at the center

Pigment is at the periphery

Medullary Index (MI)

More than 0.5

0.33 or less

questions.text: During an autopsy, forensic experts find hair strands embedded in the victim's scalp with a swollen bulb and ruptured sheath. What does this evidence suggest about the circumstances of the victim's death?

options.label: A
options.text: The hair fell out naturally.

options.label: B
options.text: The victim was forcibly restrained.

options.label: C
options.text: The hair was dyed before death.

options.label: D
options.text: The victim had a medical condition.

questions.correct_answer: B. The victim was forcibly restrained.

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding semen analysis tests is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: The fluorescence test results are bluish-white.

options.label: B
options.text: The Acid phosphatase test is positive in aspermia

options.label: C
options.text: The CPK test detects fresh seminal stains

options.label: D
options.text: Light microscopy is confirmatory

questions.correct_answer: C. The CPK test detects fresh seminal stains

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents with allegations of sexual assault. A P/V swab was taken, and a test as shown below was performed. Which of the following tests was likely done?

options.label: A
options.text: Teichmann test

options.label: B
options.text: Barberio test

options.label: C
options.text: Takayama test

options.label: D
options.text: Florence test

questions.correct_answer: B. Barberio test
questions.explanation:
Test Name

Substance Detected

Result

Reagent Used

Mnemonic

Notes

Barberio Test

Spermine

Yellow needle-shaped crystals of Spermine Picrate

Picric acid

Barbar picks your hair with a needle

Detects Spermine from the prostate; confirms the presence of seminal fluid.

Florence Test

Choline

Dark brown rhombic crystals of Choline iodide

KI (Potassium Iodide)

Florence has 'C', C for Choline

It detects choline from the seminal vesicle and is used to identify seminal fluid.

questions.text: A forensic laboratory conducts a Florence Test on a suspected semen stain. The test yields dark brown rhombic crystals that resemble hemin crystals, indicating a positive result. Which of the following statements is true regarding the Florence Test?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a confirmatory test for the presence of semen.

options.label: B
options.text: The formation of rhombic crystals is solely due to the presence of spermatozoa.

options.label: C
options.text: False positives can occur if other substances containing choline are present.

options.label: D
options.text: The test does not require follow-up confirmatory tests.

questions.correct_answer: C. False positives can occur if other substances containing choline are present.
questions.explanation:
Step

Description

Extraction

Extract the suspected semen stain.

Drying

Dry the extract on a glass slide.

Reagent Application

Place a coverslip over the dried extract and add Florence solution (8% iodine in water with 5% potassium iodide).

Result Type

Observation

Positive Result

Formation of dark brown rhombic crystals (choline periodide) in clusters or rosettes, indicating the presence of semen. (Option B ruled out)

Negative Result

Absence of characteristic crystals, suggesting no semen is present.

questions.text: A forensic scientist is analyzing a suspected bloodstain and decides to perform the Takayama test for confirmation. Which of the following statements about the Takayama test is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: It can only be performed on fresh blood samples.

options.label: B
options.text: The presence of pink, feathery crystals indicates a positive result for blood.

options.label: C
options.text: It provides information about the species of origin of the blood sample.

options.label: D
options.text: It is less sensitive than the Teichmann test.

questions.correct_answer: B. The presence of pink, feathery crystals indicates a positive result for blood.
questions.explanation:
Step

Description

Sample Preparation

Place a small bloodstain sample on a glass slide and cover with a coverslip.

Reagent Introduction

Introduce Takayama reagent (sodium hydroxide, pyridine, glucose) under the coverslip.

Heating

Briefly heat the slide.

Crystal Formation

Observe for pink, feathery crystals of reduced alkaline hematin (hemochromogen) under a microscope.

questions.text: A forensic laboratory is using the Teichmann test to confirm the presence of blood in a suspected bloodstain. Which of the following statements regarding this test is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: The test requires the addition of sodium chloride and glacial acetic acid to the blood sample.

options.label: B
options.text: The presence of brownish rhombic-shaped crystals indicates a positive result for blood.

options.label: C
options.text: The test can reliably identify the species of origin of the blood sample.

options.label: D
options.text: False negatives may occur due to the age of the bloodstain or excessive heating.

questions.correct_answer: C. The test can reliably identify the species of origin of the blood sample.
questions.explanation:
Step

Description

Sample Preparation

Small sample of suspected bloodstain on a glass slide.

Reagents Added

Add a few crystals of sodium chloride and drops of glacial acetic acid. (Option A ruled out)

Heating

Gently heat the slide.

Crystal Formation

Formation of brownish rhombic-shaped crystals (hemin or hematin chloride) if blood is present. (Option B ruled out)

Condition

Effect on Test

Age of the Stain

Reliability decreases with age. (Option D ruled out)

Washing or Chemical Treatment

May prevent positive results.

Excess Sodium Chloride

Interferes with crystal formation.

Moisture in Glacial Acetic Acid

Can lead to negative results.

Overheating

Degrades blood components. (Option D ruled out)

questions.text: Which of the following tests is used to confirm the presence of blood by detecting red, feathery crystals of pyridine ferroprotoporphyrin?

options.label: A
options.text: Teichmann Test

options.label: B
options.text: HemaTrace Test

options.label: C
options.text: Takayama Test

options.label: D
options.text: Precipitin Test

questions.correct_answer: C. Takayama Test
questions.explanation:
Test

Description

Takayama Test

Detects hemoglobin by forming red, feathery crystals of pyridine ferroprotoporphyrin.

Teichmann Test (Option A ruled out)

Converts hemoglobin to hemin, creating brownish-yellow rhomboid crystals, confirming blood presence.

Test

Description

Precipitin Test (Option D ruled out)

Identifies species origin through antibody-antigen reactions, using antisera specific to human blood.

HemaTrace Test (Option B ruled out)

Uses monoclonal antibodies to detect human hemoglobin, showing a visible pink band for confirmation.

questions.text: A forensic investigator is analyzing a crime scene for potential blood stains. They decide to use a presumptive test that can detect trace amounts of blood but may also give false positives with other substances like bleach or rust. Which of the following is the most appropriate test for this scenario?

options.label: A
options.text: Kastle Meyer Test

options.label: B
options.text: Hemastix

options.label: C
options.text: Luminol

options.label: D
options.text: Forensic Bluestar®

questions.correct_answer: C. Luminol
questions.explanation:
Test

Working Principle

Kastle-Meyer

Hemoglobin catalyzes the oxidation of phenolphthalein, resulting in a pink color.

Hemastix

Reagent reacts with hemoglobin, causing a color change based on the concentration of hemoglobin.

Luminol

Chemiluminescent reaction occurs when luminol reacts with hemoglobin under alkaline conditions, producing a blue glow.

Forensic Bluestar®

Similar to luminol, but with enhanced sensitivity; it reacts with hemoglobin to produce a bright blue luminescence.

Method

Type

Sensitivity

Specificity

False Positives

Luminol

Presumptive

Detects trace amounts

Moderate

Metals, bleach, and other substances

Forensic Bluestar®

Presumptive

Similar to Luminol

Moderate

Same as Luminol

Kastle Meyer

Presumptive

1:16,384 dilution

High

Minimal

Hemastix

Presumptive

1:64 dilution

Low

Tomatoes, rust, and other substances
